tag_list: china, shanghai, beijing, mobile-industry, mobile-web, events
overview:
Leo Wang is the founder of Mobile2.0 Forum with 1,500+ professional members from the telecom, Internet and mobile industry. Leo is often called an extraordinary insider of China’s wireless industry and is very well connected in this sector. During the past 9 years, he’s been working in a number of fields: telecommunications, value-added services, social networking services, mobile applications, and handset platforms.

The Mobile2.0 Forum, founded in 2007 and well-known around the world, is a top level, international communication platform where telecom, mobile, and Internet industry entrepreneurs, major corporations and venture capitalists can meet and share information, make new friends and explore business opportunities.

Mobile2.0 Forum events usually consist of speeches, discussion panels, business matching, product demos and strategy workshops. According to different partners and sponsors, every event is structured differently and in a unique way.

The Mobile2.0 Forum has already partnered with industry leaders like Qualcomm, Huawei, Deutsche Telekom, FT-Orange, Symbian Foundation, China Telecom and China Mobile. The Mobile2.0 Forum delivered 50+ top level events and attracted more than 1,500 industry elite members.

The Mobile2.0 Forum serves as an activator for industry development. The”2.0” stands for “Next Generation” which can be interpreted as the slogan of the wireless Internet era, the contents & applications era and the wireless digital revolution.
